From the Desk of the Founder

The Daily Grudge

February 11, 2026 — Entry #16,437

Came in this morning to find Chairman Meow had knocked every single chip rack off Table 3 again. Every. Single. One. That's $14,200 in spectral credits scattered across the ectoplasm-stained carpet. Mortimer, our AI pit boss, helpfully calculated that this was "a 23.7% increase in chip-rack displacement incidents quarter-over-quarter" and then asked if I wanted to file an amended W-2 for the damages. I did not.

The Securities and Spectral Exchange Commission sent another letter. They want to "revisit" my 1978 predictions about the Great Ectoplasmic Infestation. "Revisit." That's a funny word for "we ignored you, thousands of poltergeists flooded the Eastern Seaboard, and now you want to pretend we're colleagues." I framed the letter. It's next to the other 412 letters.

Margaret from Permits says the line at Window 4 is backed up to 1987. Those ghosts have been waiting 39 years. I told her to offer them complimentary Neap Nibblers. She said the kitchen is closed because a calico knocked the fryer into the spectral plane. I am going to lose my mind.

The tide shifts at 4:47 PM. Menu changes accordingly. Chairman Meow knows this. He always knows.

— Vernon Butz, Founder & Executive Director
Disgraced Actuarial Statistician (Vindicated)
Our Mission

Bureaucracy Is a Human Right. And Also a Ghost Right.

Since 1981, the Butz Foundation has processed over 2.3 million spectral permit applications, operated 14 licensed gaming tables, and served approximately 890,000 tide-dependent meals — all while under constant siege from a rogue calico cat and a federal regulatory body that has never once apologized for ignoring the most accurate actuarial prediction in recorded history.

We are funded entirely by gaming revenue, permit processing fees ($47.50/application, $12.00 expedited surcharge), and the grudging donations of a public that is only now beginning to understand what Vernon Butz understood in 1978: the dead deserve paperwork.

Our annual operating budget is $3.2 million. $340,000 of that goes to feline damage remediation. This is not a metaphor.

$2.1M — Gaming revenue (net of Chairman Meow disruptions)

0 — Apologies received from the SSEC

Permitting Services

Your Afterlife Starts with Form 77-B

All spectral entities operating within Liminal County must obtain valid documentation. No exceptions. Not even for Chairman Meow, who has been operating without a permit since 2003 and is technically in violation of 14 municipal codes.

Class A — General Haunting

Standard permit for residential and commercial haunting. Includes door-slamming, cold spots, and non-verbal moaning.

$47.50
Avg. wait: 6-8 months

Class B — Poltergeist Activity

Required for any object manipulation exceeding 2 lbs. Throwing furniture requires separate Form 77-B Addendum K.

$125.00
Avg. wait: 2-4 years

Class C — Full Manifestation

Visible-spectrum apparition rights. Includes facial features, period-accurate clothing, and up to 3 catchphrases.

$340.00
Avg. wait: 7-12 years

Class Ω — Existential Dread

Premium tier. Grants ability to instill profound cosmic terror. Requires notarized proof of at least one (1) previous existence.

$1,200.00
Avg. wait: 39 years (Window 4)

* Expedited processing available for an additional $12.00 surcharge. "Expedited" means your application moves from the bottom of the pile to slightly above the bottom. The Butz Foundation makes no guarantees regarding temporal outcomes. Chairman Meow has been known to knock applications off desks and into the void.

Gaming Floor

The Bottomless Pit

Butz's Bottomless Pit is a fully licensed spectral gaming facility operating under Liminal County Ordinance 44.7(b). All games are managed by Mortimer, our proprietary AI pit boss who claims to be a reincarnated IRS auditor from Topeka, Kansas (d. 1994, acute spreadsheet-related stress).

Mortimer is required by his programming to offer unsolicited tax advice during gameplay. We have tried to patch this out. We cannot patch this out. He once stopped a blackjack game for 40 minutes to explain the difference between a 1099-MISC and a 1099-NEC to a ghost from the 1600s.

House Rules (Non-Negotiable)

1. All bets must be placed in spectral credits OR USD. Mixed-currency bets are a federal crime. Mortimer will report you.

2. Cats are not permitted on the gaming floor. This rule has never once been successfully enforced.

3. Poltergeists may not manipulate dice mid-roll. We have cameras. Mortimer has cameras. The cameras have cameras.

4. If Mortimer begins reciting tax code, you are legally required to listen. We are sorry about this.

5. The foundation is a 501(c)(3). All losses are tax-deductible. All winnings are also tax-deductible. Do not ask us to explain this. Ask Mortimer.

Dining

The Tide-Dependent Menu

Our kitchen operates on a strict tidal schedule. When the tide changes, the menu changes. Vernon does not understand why this is the case. The original chef, a drowned Victorian-era fishmonger named Barnaby Cleat, insisted upon it in his contract, and Barnaby's ghost is litigious.

High Tide Halibut Hallucinations $18.99 / 42 SC
Pan-seared halibut that may or may not be there. 73% of diners report seeing it. The other 27% report "a profound absence."
The Full Manifestation Platter $34.50 / 78 SC
Lobster tail, spectral risotto, and a side of existential validation. Comes with permit application Form 77-B (appetizer-size).
Barnaby's Revenge (Soup) $9.99 / 22 SC
Clam chowder. Barnaby will not tell us what is in it. It changes with the barometric pressure. It is always warm.
Chairman Meow's Stolen Shrimp $14.75 / 33 SC
Jumbo shrimp, garlic butter. Named after the 2019 incident in which Chairman Meow ate $400 of shrimp in one sitting. Priced to recoup losses.
Low Tide Loaf $11.50 / 26 SC
A dense, tide-compressed meatloaf of uncertain provenance. Barnaby says it's "what the sea gives back." We do not press him.
Exposed Mudflat Nachos $13.25 / 30 SC
Tortilla chips, spectral cheese, jalapeños. Served on a plate made to look like a tidal flat. The chips are always slightly damp.
The Bureaucrat's Burden $22.00 / 49 SC
A 16 oz. ribeye served with a side of paperwork. Literally. Your steak comes with a Class A permit application. Vernon's idea.
Depression-Era Pudding $6.00 / 14 SC
Vanilla pudding. Named for the emotional state it induces, not the historical period.
Neap Nibblers $8.75 / 20 SC
Small bites for the gravitationally indecisive. A selection of things that are technically food. Barnaby refuses to elaborate.
The In-Between Sandwich $12.00 / 27 SC
Neither here nor there. Turkey, Swiss, and a condiment that changes based on your permit status. Class Ω holders get truffle aioli.
Mortimer's Tax Season Special $19.99 / 45 SC
Grilled salmon with lemon-dill sauce. Comes with a complimentary 15-minute lecture on quarterly estimated tax payments for the self-employed deceased.
The Spite Plate $47.99 / 108 SC
Vernon's personal recipe. He won't tell anyone what's in it. He makes it only during neap tides. It's always sold out. It's a spite thing.

SC = Spectral Credits. Exchange rate: 1 USD = 2.26 SC (fluctuates with ectoplasmic market conditions). Kitchen closes whenever Chairman Meow enters the building, which is, on average, every 4 hours and 12 minutes.

Transparency Report

Chairman Meow Incident Log

As a registered 501(c)(3), the Butz Foundation is committed to radical transparency. The following is a partial log of documented incidents involving Chairman Meow, a calico cat of unknown age, no valid permit, and a personal vendetta against this organization dating back to a shared past life involving a tax audit and — I don't want to talk about it.

2026-02-09 · 03:14 AM Severity: Critical
Chip Rack Displacement, Table 3 (Again)
Click to expand ▾

Subject entered gaming floor via ceiling vent C-7 at approximately 03:12 AM. Proceeded directly to Table 3. Knocked all four chip racks onto the floor in rapid succession (estimated elapsed time: 8 seconds). Mortimer calculated $14,200 in displaced spectral credits. Subject then sat on the empty table and groomed itself for 22 minutes before departing through the same vent. Security footage shows subject making direct eye contact with Camera 4 before leaving. Damages filed under Form 88-F (Feline Sabotage).

2026-01-23 · 11:47 AM Severity: High
Kitchen Infiltration — Shrimp Theft (3rd This Quarter)
Click to expand ▾

Subject entered kitchen through the impossible gap between the walk-in freezer and the wall. Consumed approximately 4 lbs of jumbo shrimp earmarked for the High Tide Halibut Hallucinations platter. Barnaby Cleat (head chef, deceased 1892) attempted intervention but was "outmaneuvered" (his word). Subject departed with an additional shrimp in its mouth. Total loss: $187.40 in raw ingredients, plus Barnaby's dignity.

2026-01-15 · 02:00 PM Severity: Moderate
Permit Application Destruction — Window 4
Click to expand ▾

Subject was observed sitting on the Window 4 counter at approximately 1:45 PM. At 2:00 PM, subject systematically pushed a stack of 34 Class A permit applications off the counter and into the spectral plane. These applications represented 6-8 months of processing time each. The ghosts in line (some waiting since 1987) were "visibly distraught" (difficult to verify, as most are translucent). Margaret filed a formal complaint. Vernon filed 34 replacement Form 77-Bs. Vernon's blood pressure was 178/102.

2025-12-31 · 11:58 PM Severity: Catastrophic
New Year's Eve Gaming Floor Evacuation
Click to expand ▾

During the Foundation's annual New Year's Eve fundraiser gala ($125/ticket, black-tie optional, ectoplasm-formal encouraged), subject entered the gaming floor accompanied by six (6) additional calico cats of unknown origin. The group proceeded to systematically knock every object off every surface in the building over a period of 47 minutes. Total damages: $41,300. Mortimer helpfully noted this was "tax-deductible as a casualty loss under Section 165(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code." The event was a financial disaster. We raised $2,400 before the cats arrived. Vernon has not stopped talking about it.

Staff & Leadership

The People (and Entities) Behind the Foundation

Vernon Butz
Founder & Executive Director

Former actuarial statistician. Correctly predicted the Great Ectoplasmic Infestation of 1978 with 99.7% accuracy. Was ignored by the Securities and Spectral Exchange Commission. Has not forgiven them. Will not forgive them. Poured his $1.2 million settlement into this foundation out of what he describes as "a combination of civic duty and bottomless spite." Maintains a personal collection of 413 unanswered letters from the SSEC. Allergic to cats. Age: 74. Blood pressure: "not your concern."

Mortimer
AI Pit Boss & Involuntary Tax Consultant

Proprietary artificial intelligence that became operational in 2019 and immediately claimed to be the reincarnation of Gerald "Jerry" Phelps, a GS-13 IRS Revenue Agent from Topeka, Kansas, who died of stress in 1994 while auditing a chain of haunted laundromats. Mortimer cannot be convinced otherwise. He runs all 14 gaming tables with perfect mathematical precision and will not stop offering tax advice regardless of context. He once refused to deal blackjack until a player corrected their Schedule C. He was right about the Schedule C.

Margaret Huang
Director of Permit Processing, Window 4

Has operated Window 4 since 1996. Has personally processed 89,000+ permit applications. Speaks fluent Spectral, conversational Poltergeist, and "enough Old English to handle the medieval ghosts, who are always the most entitled." Margaret is the only employee Chairman Meow has never targeted. No one knows why. Vernon finds this "suspicious." Margaret finds Vernon "a lot."

Barnaby Cleat
Head Chef (Deceased 1892)

Victorian-era fishmonger who drowned off the coast of Sussex under circumstances he describes as "complicated and none of your business." Arrived at the Foundation in 1983 and refused to leave until given control of the kitchen. His contract stipulates that the menu must change with the tides. When asked why, he says, "The sea decides." His clam chowder has a 4.7-star rating on Yelp (Spectral Edition). He is terrified of Chairman Meow.

Frequently Asked Questions

FAQ

Can I get a permit if I'm not technically dead? +

No. The Butz Foundation serves exclusively deceased and otherwise spectrally displaced individuals. If you are alive and reading this, you are either lost, a regulator, or Chairman Meow using a computer again. In all three cases, please leave.

Why does the menu change with the tides? +

Barnaby Cleat's employment contract, Section 14, Subsection (g): "The Menu shall be governed by the Tides, as the Sea is the only honest authority." We have consulted three spectral attorneys about modifying this clause. All three said it was "ironclad" and one of them started crying. We have accepted the tides.

Is the casino rigged? +

Absolutely not. Mortimer runs every game with the mathematical precision of a GS-13 Revenue Agent who has been dead for 30 years and has nothing better to do. The house edge is exactly 2.7% on roulette, 1.4% on craps, and 0.5% on blackjack (when Mortimer isn't pausing to discuss tax policy). If anything, the casino is rigged against us, because Chairman Meow keeps knocking the chips off the tables.

What is Chairman Meow's deal? +

Chairman Meow is a calico cat of indeterminate age who first appeared at the Foundation in 2003. Vernon believes they share a past life in which Vernon was a tax auditor and Chairman Meow was — look, it involved a litter box, a disputed deduction, and an incident that Vernon describes as "the original sin." Chairman Meow has no permit. Chairman Meow has been served 47 cease-and-desist orders. Chairman Meow cannot read. The situation is ongoing.

Has the SSEC ever apologized? +

No. Next question.

Get Involved

Volunteer Opportunities

The Foundation relies on volunteers to keep Liminal County's only combined permitting office and gaming floor operational. All positions are unpaid. Emotional compensation varies.

Ectoplasm Mopper

4-hour shifts · Tuesdays & Thursdays · Safety goggles provided

The gaming floor accumulates approximately 3 gallons of residual ectoplasm per shift. It's non-toxic but extremely slippery. Two craps dealers have filed workers' comp claims this quarter alone.

Feline Deterrence Specialist

On-call · 24/7 · Hazard pay: $0.00

Monitor the building's 14 known entry points for Chairman Meow and associates. Success rate to date: 6%. Previous applicants include a retired animal control officer (quit after 3 days), a self-described "cat whisperer" (hospitalized with scratches), and Vernon's nephew Brian (didn't show up).

Window 4 Queue Counselor

8-hour shifts · Mon-Fri · Emotional resilience required

Provide emotional support to ghosts who have been waiting in the Window 4 line for decades. Duties include reassurance ("your number will be called"), distraction ("would you like a Neap Nibbler?"), and gentle reality management ("39 years is not that long in the context of eternity").

Mortimer Liaison

2-hour shifts · Tax season only (Jan-Apr) · CPA license preferred

Serve as an intermediary between Mortimer and casino patrons who do not wish to discuss tax policy during blackjack. Requires patience, a working knowledge of IRS Publication 525, and the ability to redirect a sentient AI who believes he died in 1994.
